title: Two pipes a and b can fill a tank in 18 and 24 minutes respectively both pipes are opened simultaneously then after how much time will pipe B we need to be close to fill the tank completely in 12 minutes? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are Many ways to solve this but i try to give less complex by taking suitable variable values. Let total volume of tank be (Lcm of 18 and 24) Ltrso total volume be 72 ltr so volume filled by tap a in 1 minute= 72/18 = 4 ltrvolume filled by tap b in 1 min = 72/24 = 3 ltr Now tap a is kept open for 12 mins and tap b is kept open for x mins ( x<12)and the tank is filled. so 12*4 + x*3 = 72ltr→3x = 72–48→x= 24/3 = 8mins So tap b should be closed after 8th min and tap a should be open for 12 mins to fill the tank hope it helped.:)

Solution of the given problem is shown below, Let V denotes the total capacity of the given tank.It is mentioned that(i) Two pipes A & B can completely fill total capacity V of the tank in 18 and 24 minutes respectively. Hence,(ii) Pipes A & B alone in 1 min can fill the tank up to fractional amounts V/18 & V/24 respectively.(iii) Both pipes A & B are opened simultaneously and then let T denotes the time (in min) after which pipe B will be needed to close to fill the tank completely in 12 minutes.Hence from (ii) & (iii) we get following relation,T*(V/18 + V/24 ) + (12 - T)*V/18 = Vor T/24 = 1 - 2/3 = 1/3 or T = 24/3 = 8 (min) [Ans]

As per the problem, in 1 minute, pipe a can fill 1/18th and pipe b can fill 1/24th part. Pipe a will be opened for 12 minutes. Hence in 12 minutes, pipe a can fill = 12*1/18= 2/3 rd part. Hence remaining = 1–2/3= 1/3rd part to be filled by pipe b. Time taken to fill 1/3 rd part by pipe b = (1/3)/(1/24)=24/3=8 minutes. Thus pipe b should be closed after 8 minutes if the tank to be filled completely in 12 minutes. HTH
